Posts.Content: theBCavenger wrote: I am having issues with skin/tissue dying on the cancer side. I have TE's too, and am sure I will be having surgery this Tuesday to clean up all the debris and start again. Several people have mentioned the need for protein... so many different Whey Protein drinks! Any suggestions?  MRI Dx stage 3. 12/8/11 BMX, AND with TE - Lab put me at stage 1 - 2/1/12 Oncotype DX score 16, no chemo. 4/12 Stage 1 LE. Dx 11/8/2011, IDC, Right, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 1, 0/32 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 12/7/2011 Lymph node removal: Right, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 1/16/2012 Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Hormonal Therapy 1/31/2012 Surgery 4/16/2012 Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 1/29/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 2/5/2013 Reconstruction (left) Surgery 5/20/2013 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 4/15/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Which Whey Protein is Best? theBCavenger newfmama

Posts.Content: theBCavenger wrote: I met with the oncologist yesterday and I am not very happy! I had my double mastectomy Dec. 8th, 32 nodes removed and expanders placed. Since the surgery, I have been under the impression that I was not going to need chemo since there was no lymph invasion.  I am now told Chemo is required for all tumors over 1cm. Mine was 1.5cm. If I do the chemo, will need to get a port installed as, due to the lymph removal, they can only use the veins on my left arm, and thy don't want them to collapse. That means a total of 2 more surgeries for the port installation/removal and at least one more for the reconstruction! UUUGGHHHHH! I guess there is some test they can do that is very expensive that tells if you are at a high/low risk of recurrence, and I have requested this test. I felt good about my choice, but now everyone is telling me I should get the chemo! If it wasn't for the extra operations, it would be an easier choice for me.  Why a I such a big baby about all this??? Why can't I just be more accepting of the surgeries??? Everyone of the surgeries I will need will be outpatient, obviously the hardest one is already done, yet I can't stop freaking out! MRI Dx stage 3. 12/8/11 BMX, AND with TE - Lab put me at stage 1 - 2/1/12 Oncotype DX score 16, no chemo. 4/12 Stage 1 LE. Posts.Title: CHEMO??? theBCavenger theBCavenger

Posts.Content: theBCavenger wrote: After two weeks without a normal shower, I was so excited yesterday to take my first one after double mastectomy with expanders placed. I tried very hard to not look, but did happen to see a little... very upsetting, think I cried for a couple hours. Had my 14 year old daughter help, as I did not think it was going to be that bad. I made a bad choice!  MRI Dx stage 3. 12/8/11 BMX, AND with TE - Lab put me at stage 1 - 2/1/12 Oncotype DX score 16, no chemo. 4/12 Stage 1 LE.
